Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 30th overall pick, by Troy in 1973...
Traded from Troy to Wisconsin on 1/31/1975 (Going to TRO: 2B O. Erhart. Going to WIS: P J. Brace, P R. Barnett)...
Injured on 4/3/1975 with a Ruptured Tricep Tendon, out for 4 weeks...
Earned first career win on 4/2/1977...
Had first career hit on 4/15/1977, off John Teller (NJ)...
Hit first career homerun on 7/10/1977, off Eddie Harris (PG)...
Traded from Wisconsin to Lynchburg on 4/1/1981 (Going to LYN: P R. Barnett, P J. Reddington. Going to WIS: RF R. Battle, SS J. Gullickson, P R. Robitaille)...
Signed as a free agent by Bay City on 2/14/1983 to a 3-year deal worth $1,842,300 per year...
Won World Championship with Bay City in 1984...
